text_content: üîç Is XRP finally breaking out, or is this another fake move?  $XRP  is pushing out of a long period of triangle compression and is now trying to confirm a trend shift. This kind of structure often precedes expansion, but only if the breakout holds.  The bullish case stays intact while price remains above the breakout level, flips the former triangle top into support, and continues to respect the rising trendline. That behavior signals acceptance, not just a wick.  If price slips back inside the triangle, the move likely needs more time and the breakout thesis gets delayed or invalidated.  üëâ Do you see this as the start of a real trend change for XRP, or another range trap?  #XRP  #Ripple  #XRPPriceAnalysis  #AltcoinSeason

$XRP All the short liquidations that happened since yesterday on the traders‚Äô side are actually very easy to understand.


When the majority of people have the idea that BTC will go to 70k, that same majority opens massive short positions. This is very often used by big players to liquidate traders on a large scale.


Many traders short every red candle, and then they get caught by violent rebounds.


It‚Äôs important to understand the system: the 70k zone is a trap support ü™§, created to trigger emotions among traders. These emotions push them to open millions in short positions. This benefits the big players, because it becomes easy money to liquidate with only a small amount of liquidity injected into the market, allowing them to make even more profit.


That‚Äôs why the market will never drop in a straight line to 70k. They will always exploit massive liquidations on both sides (long and short) until traders no longer have enough money to keep shorting.


Only then will they use other strategies to reach their main objective.


For now, the market is highly manipulated and full of traps. Suivre

$XRP   rebounded from its moving averages on Tuesday, indicating strong buying interest at lower levels. The rising 20-day EMA at $2.06 and an RSI in positive territory suggest that buyers remain in control, increasing the likelihood of a break above the downtrend line. $XRP   ETFs Record Largest Volume in Five Trading Days Amid $10.63M Inflow.  XRP ETFs extend the current inflow streak with $10.63 million in daily net flow, as their total traded value reaches a five-day high.    Specifically, data from SosoValue shows that the five US XRP spot ETFs recorded a daily trading volume of $44.11 million on January 14. Notably, this was the highest level of market participation in the last five market days. Such volume was last seen on January 6, when the funds brought in $19.12 million.    The increasing volume matters, as it shows strong interest among institutional and retail investors. As volume grows, liquidity rises too.  The notable volume spike ticked in favor of accumulation rather than distribution, as market users bought more XRP ETFs than they sold on Wednesday. Data shows the investment vehicles attracted a net inflow of $10.63 million.    Leading these inflows was the Grayscale XRP Trust ETF (GXRP). The fund brought in $7.09 million yesterday, translating to an accumulation of 3.3 million XRP tokens.    Two other ETFs, the Franklin XRP ETF (XRPZ) and the Bitwise XRP ETF (XRP), recorded net inflows of $7.09 million and $1.20 million, respectively. This resulted in the funds purchasing 1.09 million XRP and 559,690 XRP, respectively. Canary XRP ETF and 21Shares XRP ETF saw zero flows.    The Wednesday inflows extended the funds‚Äô daily net inflow streak to five days, attracting $52.3 million in the process.  Their cumulative total net inflows stand at $1.2 billion, and the total net assets at $1.56 billion.
